frame.name: Passing_off
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts in such a way as to cause others to think that an <fen>Item</fen> is an instance of a particular kind of <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="agt">He</fex> had, under the name of Armitage, <t>passed</t> <fex name="Item">her</fex> <t>off</t> <fex name="Simulated_entity">as a member of one of the most distinguished families of the capital</fex>.</ex>
<ex>He undoubtedly believes you are <fex name="agt">the impostor</fex> <fex name="agt">who</fex> <t>palmed</t> <fex name="Item">himself</fex> <t>off</t> at Bar Harbor <fex name="Simulated_entity">as the Baron von Kissel</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Knowing his likeness to the family of Lord Polperro <fex name="agt">she</fex> <t>palmed</t> <fex name="Item">him</fex> <t>off</t> <fex name="Audience">on them</fex> <fex name="Simulated_entity">as a distant relative</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that the <fen>Item</fen> is a particular (kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
<ex>Most recently, <fex name="agt">Grant Palmer</fex> has <t>palmed</t> himself <t>off</t> as a high-placed "insider" in the Church.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the passing off event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way) and salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>).</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that contributes to the <fen>Item</fen> being perceived as a (particular kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Item</fen> is the concrete or abstract entity that the Agent misleadingly represents as a particular (kind of) <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>From all reports Muhammad <t>passed</t> <fex name="Item">the child</fex> <t>off</t> as his son and behaved accordingly.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by passing the <fen>Item</fen> off as a (particular kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the passing-off event logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Simulated_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Simulated_entity</fen> is a particular individual or a token of a particular type that the <fen>Item</fen> is represented as.
<ex>The colleague who stole your idea and <t>passed</t> it <t>off</t> <fex name="Simulated_entity">as her own</fex>? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location that is the setting for the passing off event.
<ex><fex name="Place">In London</fex> she <t>passed</t> herself <t>off</t> as a rich American heiress.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Audience
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Audience</fen> denotes the people that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to mislead into thinking that the <fen>Item</fen> is a particular (kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
<ex>Ritchie <t>passed</t> it <t>off</t> <fex name="Audience">to them</fex> as his own original thinking.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression that the <fen>Item</fen> is the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: palm off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sell or dispose of something by misrepresentation or fraud.
